segments.text: I see the water just gushing out of the sink, and it’s making a huge puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman doesn’t seem to care at all, and that’s really frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she just stand there drying dishes while everything is getting soaked?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall off that stool, and she’s completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at her to turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the scene looks from the outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden through the window looks so peaceful, it’s almost annoying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall and hurt himself while she’s not looking.
segments.speaker: PAR
